afghanistan.notes: Visa not required for those of Afghan origin.

angola.notes: Passengers with a confirmation that a visa has been approved before departure can obtain a visa on arrival.

australia.notes: May apply online (Online Visitor e600 visa).

austria.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

azerbaijan.notes:
90 days within any 180 day period
If staying more than 15 days passengers visiting relatives must register with local police. If staying in a hotel, this will be arranged by the hotel.
Who are of Armenian descent Government of Azerbaijan bans the entry.

belarus.notes: The internal passport (booklets only) is valid for border crossing.

belgium.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

belize.notes: Visa on arrival for those holding a valid US visa or Schengen visa.

benin.notes: Must have an international vaccination certificate.

bhutan.notes:
Passengers with an application for a tourist visa can obtain a visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 15 days if the application is sent by a tour operator to the Department of Tourism at least 2 and a half months in advance.
The passenger must have 2 passport photos.

bolivia.notes:
Only if the passengers has an invitation letter issued by the Bolivian Immigration Authorities (DIGEMIG) or a printed hotel reservation.
Also they must have sufficient funds (credit card, cash or bank statement) and 1 passport photo.

burkina_faso.notes: Can be obtained at border control.

china.notes:
72-hour visit without a visa when in transit at Changsha, Chengdu, Chongqing, Guangzhou, Guilin, Harbin, Kunming, Qingdao, Wuhan, Xi'an and Xiamen.144-hours visit without a visa when in transit through Beijing Capital International Airport, Dalian, Hangzhou, Shijiazhuang Zhengding International Airport in Hebei, Nanjing, Shanghai Hongqiao International Airport and Shanghai Pudong International Airport, Shanghai Railway Station and the Port of Shanghai); Shenyang and Tianjin Binhai International Airport
Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan do count as third countries under the 72 and 144-hours visa-free visit transit policy.

czech_republic.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

denmark.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

egypt.notes: Tourists arriving at Sharm El Sheikh, Saint Catherine or Taba airports and remaining in the Sinai resorts do not require a visa up to 15 days.

eritrea.notes: Passengers with a confirmation that a visa has been approved before departure can obtain a visa on arrival if sponsor in Eritrea submits the request to the Eritrean Immigration Authority 48 hours before arrival and passengers hold 1 passport photo.

estonia.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

finland.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

france.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

germany.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

ghana.notes:
Citizens of Ukraine can obtain a visa on arrival if they have a copy of a visa-on-arrival approval issued (at least 48 hours prior to traveling to Ghana) by the Ghana Immigration Service.
The approval must contain both traveler's passport and visa numbers and a copy of the bio-data and photo page of the applicant's passport.

greece.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

grenada.notes: Citizens of Ukraine can obtain a visa on arrival if they have a pre-clearance letter issued by Grenada.

guinea.notes: Citizens of Ukraine with an approval letter issued by the "Directeur Central de la Police de l'Air et des Frontieres" can obtain a visa on arrival.

guyana.notes: Passengers traveling as tourists can obtain a visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 30 days if they have a letter of invitation from sponsor or host (with their contact details) and 2 passport photos.

hungary.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

iceland.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

india.notes:
e-Visa holders must arrive via 25 designated airports[Note 2] or 3 designated seaports.[Note 3]
An Indian e-Tourist Visa can only be obtained twice in one calendar year.
Applying online.

iran.notes:
Citizens of Ukraine can obtain a visa on arrival at airports Gheshm Island, Kish Island, Mashhad, Esfahan, Shiraz, Tabriz and Tehran Imam Khomeini.
Admission will be refused:
to women not wearing Islamic head cover, scarf, long sleeves or stockings
to holders of passports containing an Israeli visa/stamp in the last 12 months [better source needed]

iraq.notes:
Holders of passports containing an Israeli stamp or visa will be refused entry in Iraq.
This restriction does not apply at airport Erbil.

ireland.notes: Transit visa also required since 9 June 2017.

italy.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

south_korea.notes: Visa not required for 30 days for Jeju Island.

laos.notes:
Conditions apply.
Available at international airports Luangphabang, Pakse, Savannakhet and Vientiane, and at 4 land borders Friendship Bridge,[Note 4] and at 13 border crossings[Note 5] as well as Tanalaeng train station in Vientiane, which connects to the train station in Nongkai, Thailand.
Entry points Lalai, Lantui, Meuang mom, Pakxan, and Phoudou are open only to visa holders.
Extendable up to 60 days.

latvia.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

lebanon.notes: Holders of passports containing an Israeli stamp or visa will be refused entry in Lebanon.

libya.notes: Holders of passports containing an Israeli stamp or visa will be refused entry in Libya.

liechtenstein.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

lithuania.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

luxembourg.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

malta.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

mongolia.notes: Provided holding an official or private invitation.

myanmar.notes:
eVisa holders must arrive via Yangon, Nay Pyi Taw or Mandalay airports or via land border crossings with Thailand — Tachileik, Myawaddy and Kawthaung.
eVisa is available for tourism and business purposes.

netherlands.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

nigeria.notes: Pre-approved visa on arrival is available.

norway.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

pakistan.notes:
Visa on arrival when travelling on business valid for 30 days.
Conditions apply.

poland.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

portugal.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

qatar.notes:
Available at Hamad International Airport.
eVisa is also available.

russia.notes: The internal passport (booklets and ID cards) are valid for border crossing.

saudi_arabia.notes: Holders of passports containing an Israeli stamp or visa will be refused entry in Saudi Arabia.

serbia.notes: A new visa waiver for 90/180 days has been signed. Not yet in effect.

singapore.notes: Applying online. Allowed visa-free transit for 96 hours.

slovakia.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

slovenia.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

somalia.notes: Available at Bosaso Airport, Galcaio Airport and Mogadishu Airport.

spain.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

sudan.notes: Holders of passports containing an Israeli stamp or visa will be refused entry in Sudan.

suriname.notes: Citizens of Ukraine can obtain a visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 2 months. They must have confirmation that a visa has been approved before departure.

sweden.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

switzerland.notes: 90 days within any 180 day period in the Schengen Area[Note 1]

syria.notes: According to the IATA database, visa may be obtained on arrival and is valid for 15 days. According to the Law No. 2 of 2014 all visitors require visas prior to arrival. Holders of passports containing an Israeli stamp or visa will be refused entry in Syria.

tunisia.notes: Visa not required for tourist groups organised by a travel agency.

vietnam.notes: 30 days visa free on Phú Quốc

yemen.notes: Holders of passports containing an Israeli stamp or visa will be refused entry in Yemen.
